intro: Kedrostis boehmii, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its roots are fibrous and have been traditionally used for their starchy properties. Kedrostis boehmii is often cultivated for its edible roots and has some medicinal applications in traditional medicine.
